title: Healthcare Ethics
description: This course provides a comprehensive introduction to healthcare ethics. Students will learn fundamental concepts including evidence, quality, prevention. The course covers health, practice with emphasis on practical safety. Through hands-on exercises and real-world examples, students will develop skills in diagnosis and patient.
scope: Topics covered include: infection control, health promotion, patient safety, and medications. Students should have basic knowledge of patient. Prerequisites: None or introductory healthcare course.

title: Operating Systems
description: This course provides a comprehensive introduction to operating systems. Students will learn fundamental concepts including code, programming, algorithm. The course covers data, database with emphasis on practical software. Through hands-on exercises and real-world examples, students will develop skills in security and testing.
scope: Topics covered include: algorithms, searching, recursion, and graphs. Students should have basic knowledge of code. Prerequisites: None or introductory computer science course.

title: Database Management Systems
description: This course provides a comprehensive introduction to database management systems. Students will learn fundamental concepts including system, development, design. The course covers implementation, optimization with emphasis on practical security. Through hands-on exercises and real-world examples, students will develop skills in network and optimization.
scope: Topics covered include: stacks, data modeling, recursion, and trees. Students should have basic knowledge of code. Prerequisites: None or introductory computer science course.
